meanings.definition: A person who advocates for the rebuilding or reorganization of a society or system.
meanings.sent1: The reconstructionists in our community are passionate about improving our town's infrastructure.
meanings.sent2: The reconstructionists proposed a new plan to revitalize the local economy.
meanings.sent3: The reconstructionists had a big idea to rearrange the town square for better traffic flow.
meanings.sent4: She was like a reconstructionist of dreams, piecing together a better future for all.
meanings.sent5: The reconstructionists were like architects, designing a better tomorrow for everyone.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who seek to revive or restore traditional practices or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The reconstructionists gathered to preserve the old customs of their ancestors.
meanings.sent2: In the village, the reconstructionists worked hard to bring back ancient traditions.
meanings.sent3: The reconstructionists were like time travelers, bringing back forgotten rituals.
meanings.sent4: Their dedication to tradition made the reconstructionists a pillar of the community.
meanings.sent5: The reconstructionists were the guardians of the past, ensuring it lived on in the present.

meanings.definition: Those who work to reconstruct historical events or artifacts.
meanings.sent1: The reconstructionists meticulously pieced together the fragments of the ancient vase.
meanings.sent2: As reconstructionists, they painstakingly recreated the scene of the battle.
meanings.sent3: The reconstructionists were like detectives, solving the mysteries of the past.
meanings.sent4: Their work as reconstructionists brought history back to life in vivid detail.
meanings.sent5: The reconstructionists were like artists, restoring the beauty of the past for all to see.
